text: " besides , if we go out too late , nobody will see us , " said porthos , " and that will be a pity .
he hurt my shoulder . and you , porthos ? " " faith !
i am going to fight -- because i am going to fight , " answered porthos , reddening .

planchet and grimaud appeared in their turn , leading their masters ’ steeds . d’artagnan and athos put themselves into saddle with their companions , and all four set forward ; athos upon a horse he owed to a woman , aramis on a horse he owed to his mistress , porthos on a horse he owed to his procurator ’s wife , and d’artagnan on a horse he owed to his good fortune -- the best mistress possible .
" and you were right , " cried aramis and porthos , with one voice .
" hush ! " said porthos , placing a finger on his lips . " i believe her to be a cardinalist ; she must know nothing of the matter . "
porthos alone made no reply .
" because , as porthos was talking louder than the rest of us , he took him for the chief , " said d’artagnan .
the fair worshipper touched the great hand of porthos with her delicate fingers , smiled , made the sign of the cross , and left the church .
porthos pretended to be confused .

" yes , " said porthos , " that is a duchess of my acquaintance whom i have great trouble to meet on account of the jealousy of her husband , and who sent me word that she should come today to this poor church , buried in this vile quarter , solely for the sake of seeing me . "

" less quickly than the women , it seems to me , " replied porthos ; " for i , madame , i may say i was your victim , when wounded , dying , i was abandoned by the surgeons . i , the offspring of a noble family , who placed reliance upon your friendship -- i was near dying of my wounds at first , and of hunger afterward , in a beggarly inn at chantilly , without you ever deigning once to reply to the burning letters i addressed to you . "
" besides , what did i ask of you ? " resumed porthos , with a movement of the shoulders full of good fellowship . " a loan , nothing more !
" the doubles the offense , " said porthos , disengaging his arm from that of the procurator ’s wife ; " for if you are rich , madame coquenard , then there is no excuse for your refusal . "
" ah , madame , " said porthos , in the most melancholy tone he could assume , " when we are about to enter upon a campaign -- a campaign , in which my presentiments tell me i shall be killed-- "
" i thought i had , " said porthos , resuming his melancholy air ; " but i have been taught my mistake . "
" you are a woman of precaution , i see , my dear madame coquenard , " said porthos , squeezing the hand of the procurator ’s wife tenderly .
" the gascon is full of ideas , " said porthos , with admiration .
" we were in a place where it was not very cold , " replied porthos , giving his mustache a twist which was peculiar to him .
" oh , good lord , " cried porthos , " what precautions for the study of theology ! "
" a woman of such inferior condition ! can you believe so ? " said porthos , protruding his lips with contempt .
" what diabolical villainy you have performed here , " said porthos , when the officer had rejoined his companions and the four friends found themselves alone .
" but this creature must be a demon ! " said porthos , holding out his plate to aramis , who was cutting up a fowl .

" indeed ! " thought porthos , casting a glance at the three hungry clerks -- for the errand boy , as might be expected , was not admitted to the honors of the magisterial table , " in my cousin ’s place , i would not keep such gourmands !
m coquenard was served first , then porthos . afterward mme . coquenard filled her own plate , and distributed the crusts without soup to the impatient clerks .
" the devil ! " thought porthos , " this is poor work . i respect old age , but i do n’t much like it boiled or roasted . "
porthos fancied they were mystifying him , and began to curl his mustache and knit his eyebrows ; but the knee of mme . coquenard gently advised him to be patient .
" this is fine ! " said porthos to himself ; " i am prettily caught ! "
" without reckoning , " objected porthos , " that the queen would save monsieur de buckingham , but would take no heed of us . "
" oh , no , " said porthos , " it does not exceed two thousand five hundred livres !
then put down three hundred livres , " said the procurator ’s wife , with a sigh . porthos smiled .
" ah , madame ! " said porthos , haughtily ; " do you take me for a beggar ? "
" well , agreed for a pretty mule , " said porthos ; " you are right , i have seen very great spanish nobles whose whole suite were mounted on mules .
" there remains the valise , " added porthos .
" your valise is then empty ? " asked porthos , with simplicity .
" ah , but the valise i want , " cried porthos , " is a well - filled one , my dear . "
" what ’s that ? " asked porthos , " what are they firing at now ? i hear no balls whistle , and i see nobody ! "
" ah , to be sure , " cried porthos , " there is a diamond . why the devil , then , do we plague ourselves about money , when there is a diamond ? "
" well thought of , porthos ; this time you have an idea . "
the fusillade continued ; but the four friends were out of reach , and the rochellais only fired to appease their consciences . " my faith , it was time that idea came into porthos ’s head .
porthos boasted of the strength of mousqueton , who was big enough to thrash four men of ordinary size .
" bah ! " cried porthos . " impossible !
" and i , " said porthos , rolling his large eyes , " remember , i will skin you alive . "
and porthos , turning on his heel , made a step to retire . " monsieur porthos !
" a woman of mark ! " said porthos , with his loud laugh .
" we shall see , " said porthos , majestically ; and the two separated saying , " till this evening . "
aramis mumbled verses to himself , and porthos from time to time pulled a hair or two from his mustache , in sign of despair .
" in the name of heaven , run , call ! aramis ! porthos ! call for help ! "
now , as they had already traveled eleven leagues , d’artagnan thought it time to stop , whether porthos were or were not in the inn .
" porthos is wounded , then ? "
" that ’s porthos all over , " murmured d’artagnan .
" we bear witness to this , " said porthos and aramis , in the same manner as before .
" say no more about it ? that ’s your opinion ! " replied porthos .
" ah , pardieu ! is that you ? " said porthos to d’artagnan . " you are right welcome .
bravo ! bravo ! the red duke ! " cried porthos , clapping his hands and nodding his head .

making a sign to la houdiniere and cahusac to stop , he alighted from his horse , and went toward these suspected merry companions , hoping , by means of the sand which deadened the sound of his steps and of the hedge which concealed his approach , to catch some words of this conversation which appeared so interesting . at ten paces from the hedge he recognized the talkative gascon ; and as he had already perceived that these men were musketeers , he did not doubt that the three others were those called the inseparables ; that is to say , athos , porthos , and aramis .
be one or the other , but not both , " replied porthos .

what consequence can the reverses of fortune be to you ? have you not , happy rogue that you are -- have you not your duchess , who can not fail to come to your aid ? " " well , you see , my dear d’artagnan , with what ill luck i play , " replied porthos , with the most careless air in the world .
" porthos ! "
porthos !
and why so ? " asked porthos , warmly .
and you , porthos , do you only wear such a fine golden baldric to suspend a sword of straw from it ?

" well , my captain , " said porthos , quite beside himself , " the truth is that we were six against six . but we were not captured by fair means ; and before we had time to draw our swords , two of our party were dead , and athos , grievously wounded , was very little better . for you know athos .
for the rest , as he reckoned upon returning by the same route in seven or eight days , if porthos were still at the great st . martin , he would call for him on his way .
but d’artagnan had reckoned without the wind . as he was about to pass , the wind blew out porthos ’s long cloak , and d’artagnan rushed straight into the middle of it .
" bless me ! " cried porthos , making strong efforts to disembarrass himself of d’artagnan , who was wriggling about his back ; " you must be mad to run against people in this manner . "
" i understand , " said athos ; " but why not porthos ?
